page.syntax: $u.n.toStr(value as number, decimalPlace as number [, format as string [, prefix as string [, suffix as string]]])

description.p: Convert a number into a string.

argument.name: value
argument.description: The numeric value to format into a string.

argument.name: decimalPlace
argument.description: The number of decimal places to round the number.

argument.name: format
argument.description: (Optional) Format flags indicating how to format the value. Available format flags are:

item.name: B
item.description: Return a blank string if the number equals "0".

Include a thousands separator. The default string used as a thousands separator is a comma ",". The thousands separator used is defined in *[js:$u.comma]*. You can change the thousands separator to any string you desire.
Use a "-" before the number if it is negative.
Bracket the number in parentheses if it is negative.

argument.name: prefix
argument.description: (Optional) A prefix that should be prepended to the string.

argument.name: suffix
argument.description: (Optional) A suffix that should be appended to the string.

section.title: Thousands Separator and Decimal Character
section.description: The default value for the thousands separator and decimal character are a comma "," and period ".", respectively. These values can be changed using the *[js:$u.comma]* and *[js:$u.decimal]* properties. EG:
